alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 6:16PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Ulster County through 645 PM EDT... At 615 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over West Shokan, or 15 miles west of Kingston, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West Shokan, High Falls, Olivebridge, Marbletown, Ashokan, Samsonville, Atwood, Peekamoose, Lyonsville, Winchell, Pacama, Brodhead, Stony Hollow, Lapla, Krumville, Stone Ridge, Kripplebush, Bruceville, Shokan and Lomontville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for east central New York.
